value.Name: Philosophy Club
value.Summary: A group where people can get together to converse over topics each member finds amusing! We're looking forward to discussion about our movie nights, guest speakers, and philosophical texts. We get together weekly to study and peer review! All are welcome

value.Name: Physics Society
value.Description: The purpose of the PSU Physics Society is to help students, and the community at large, develop a greater understanding and appreciation of physics. We seek to help students transition into and from academics, provide exposure to skills and knowledge that will help students post-college, and to promote having fun with physics.
value.Summary: The purpose of the PSU Physics Society is to help students, and the community at large, develop a greater understanding and appreciation of physics. We seek to help students transition into and from academics, provide exposure to skills and knowledge t..

value.Name: Planning Club
value.Description:
Planning Club's purpose is to: 1. Create a forum for dialogue on current planning issues; 2. Encourage and facilitate communication between current students, alumni and faculty in the Nohad A. Toulan School of Urban Studies and Planning, PSU and the greater Portland community; 3. Generate opportunities for professional development and community engagement for planning students and the community.

Accomplishments from the 2021-2022 Planning Club include:

Spring speaker series

Parking Day

Parking reform assistance

Volunteer partnership with Depave

Cross-program connections (Big MURP little MURP, undergraduate outreach, etc.)

OAPA conference BIPOC scholarship assistance

Game nights

Regular planning club meetings

Planning club t-shirts designed and produced

Storage locker acquired with materials for future planning club events
value.Summary: Planning Club's purpose is to create a forum for dialogue on current planning issues amongst PSU students, faculty and alumni.

value.Name: Portland Pre-Law Society
value.Description: Portland Pre-Law Society's vision is to connect students who seek to pursue a career in the legal field, giving them valuable support and guidance from their peers and instructors, as well as offering an opportunity for learning more about law and the legal field.
value.Summary: Portland Pre-Law Society's vision is to connect students who seek to pursue a career in the legal field, giving them valuable support and guidance from their peers and instructors, as well as offering an opportunity for learning more about law and the ...

value.Name: Portland State Chess
value.Description: We meet on Mondays and Thursdays 4-5:30 PM in Parkway North in the SMSU building. Boards, pieces, and clocks are provided. Players of all skill levels are welcome!
value.Summary: PSU Chess Club meets weekly for friendly matches, lessons, and tournaments.

value.Name: Portland State Production Services
value.Description:
Portland State Production Services provides sound reinforcement, lighting services, and production assistance for on-campus events that enrich the greater PSU community. In addition to this, we promote music and music technology education, while also bring free musical performances to the campus that are representative of the diverse tastes and experiences of the community. We achieve this goal in the most financially, socially, and ecologically sustainable manner possible within our means.

 

If you would like to meet us stop by the office Monday, Wednesday, or Thursday from 12:15 pm - 1:45 pm!
value.Summary: Portland State Production Services provides sound reinforcement and lighting for on-campus events! We also host a bi-weekly lunchtime concert series in Parkway North and collaborate with PSPB & KPSU for Parkway North Project

value.Name: Portland State Programming Board
value.Description: Portland State Programming Board (PSPB) is a student-run program that promotes community, pride and tradition through free cross-campus events at Portland State University. These events and programs include, but are not limited to, Midnight Breakfast, Midterm Stress Relief, and the Parkway North Project Event Series. We make PSU fun! If you're interested in helping out or joining the planning sessions, send us a message!
value.Summary: Portland State Programming Board (PSPB) is a student-run program that promotes community, pride and tradition through free cross-campus events at Portland State University. These events and programs include, but are not limited to,  Midnight Breakfast,...

value.Name: Portland State University College Democrats
value.Description: The Portland University State College Democrats is a chapter of the College Democrats of Oregon (https://www.oregoncollegedems.org/), which is affiliated with the College Democrats of America. The purpose of this organization is to unite students in the common interest of spreading awareness about Local, State, and National politics and advocating for the Democratic party. Students who join PSUCD will also work to support voter registration, organize rallies, engage with local, state, and national politics, and help to create a sense of community among PSU Democrats.
value.Summary: A chapter of the College Democrats of Oregon (affiliated with the College Democrats of America). The purpose of this organization is to unite students in the common interest of spreading awareness about politics and advocating for the Democratic party.

value.Name: Portland State University French Club
value.Description:
Join Portland State’s French Club through attending parties with French food & French cinema. No French speaking background required, but it is definitely welcome. French Holiday traditions will be celebrated throughout the year, so join us each month in learning more about them. We will have other events including faculty and potential guest speakers. We aim to build a community of people who are deeply passionate about French language and culture.

~~

Rejoinez le Club de Français en assistant des fêtes avec la nourriture et le cinéma français. Il n'est pas nécessaire savoir parler français, mais c'est certainement apprécié. Les traditions françaises des Fêtes seront célébrées tout au long de l'année, alors rejoignez-nous chaque mois pour en apprendre davantage à leur sujet. Nous aurons d'autres événements, y compris des professeurs et des conférenciers potentiels. Nous visons à bâtir une communauté de personnes profondément passionnées par la langue et la culture françaises.

JOIN OUR DISCORD SERVER HERE: discord.gg/eqhXzfrsFX
value.Summary: Join Portland State’s French Club through attending parties with French culture, food & cinema.
